abstract: Paddling a kayak, feeding a pit fire or biking around on their own, the author's sons exult in a rustic independence.
snippet: Paddling a kayak, feeding a pit fire or biking around on their own, the author's sons exult in a rustic independence.
lead_paragraph: As some of you may know, my husband and I are in the midst of a yearlong adventure off the grid with our children in the Maine woods. I recently returned from playing hooky for a few days to attend the Peace Corps 50th-anniversary celebrations in Washington along with 5,000 other returned volunteers - just a fraction of the nearly quarter-million who have served our country since J.F.K. challenged college students on a freezing campaign night in Michigan to devote their skills to helping people overseas.
